characters.name: Dr. Jonathan Swift
characters.description: Author of 'A Modest Proposal'

characters.name: American acquaintance
characters.description: A knowledgeable American living in London who assured the author about children as food

characters.name: Principal gentleman in the county of Cavan
characters.description: Gentleman who informed the author about children's criminal tendencies

characters.name: Grave author/eminent French physician
characters.description: French physician who wrote about diet and birth rates

characters.name: Worthy person/true lover of his country
characters.description: Person who suggested using older children as food

characters.name: Psalmanaazor
characters.description: Native of Formosa who told stories about eating executed criminals

characters.name: Emperor
characters.description: Emperor mentioned in Psalmanaazor's story

characters.name: Prime minister of state
characters.description: Government official who bought executed girl's body

characters.name: Plump girl of fifteen
characters.description: Girl who was crucified for attempting to poison the Emperor

characters.name: Beggars of the female sex
characters.description: Female beggars with children crowding the streets

characters.name: The Pretender
characters.description: Political figure in Spain that Irish children might fight for

characters.name: vintners
characters.description: tavern keepers who would serve the proposed food

characters.name: fine gentlemen
characters.description: wealthy men who value themselves on their knowledge of good eating

characters.name: skilful cook
characters.description: a cook who understands how to oblige his guests

characters.name: married women
characters.description: wives who would compete to bring the fattest child to market

characters.name: men
characters.description: husbands who would become fond of their wives during pregnancy

characters.name: wives
characters.description: married women who are sometimes beaten or kicked by their husbands

characters.name: Lord Mayor
characters.description: civic official who would host feasts

characters.name: reader
characters.description: the person being addressed by the narrator

characters.name: women
characters.description: referenced in context of pride, vanity, idleness, and gaming

characters.name: Laplanders
characters.description: inhabitants of Lapland, mentioned in comparison

characters.name: inhabitants of Topinamboo
characters.description: people from Topinamboo, mentioned in comparison

characters.name: Jews
characters.description: referenced as fighting amongst themselves during siege

characters.name: landlords
characters.description: property owners who should show mercy to tenants

characters.name: shopkeepers
characters.description: merchants who cheat and exact upon customers

characters.name: narrator
characters.description: the author/speaker making the proposal, has no children under 9 years old

characters.name: narrator's wife
characters.description: the narrator's spouse who is past child-bearing

book_metadata.title: and for making them beneficial to the publick.
book_metadata.author: Dr. Jonathan Swift
